purpose: Provide a tiny Tkinter GUI for rapidly redirecting filesystem junctions to different target folders, primarily to control where applications (e.g. Chrome) write files.

conceptual_model.junction_folder: A directory path on disk that acts as a redirect point, used by external programs.
conceptual_model.target_folder: A user-editable directory path that the junction should point to.
conceptual_model.mechanism: Windows NTFS directory junctions created and destroyed via mklink /J.

lionscliapp.description: A humane CLI application framework providing persistent configuration, built-in commands, and layered option management.

run.behavior: Reads junction and target from ctx (layered config), launches Tkinter GUI

target.description: Default target path for the junction

junction.description: Junction path from lionscliapp ctx (layered: default → config → CLI override).

target.description: Target path from lionscliapp ctx (layered: default → config → CLI override).

filesystem: Creates, redirects, and removes junction directories
ui: Status messages indicating success or failure of operations
Opens Windows Explorer at specified paths

widgets.description: Editable text field for the junction path. Pre-filled from ctx. Updates current state display on focus out or Enter key.

widgets.label: Select
widgets.description: Opens folder selection dialog for junction path.

widgets.label: Explore
widgets.description: Opens Windows Explorer at the junction path (or parent if it doesn't exist).
Displays the resolved target path of the existing junction, or a message if none exists.
Editable text field containing the desired target folder path. Pre-filled from ctx. Auto-updates when junction changes to a valid junction.

widgets.label: Select
widgets.description: Opens folder selection dialog for target path.

widgets.label: Explore
widgets.description: Opens Windows Explorer at the target path (or parent if it doesn't exist).
Displays the result of the last operation (success or error message).

startup: lionscliapp builds ctx from layered config (defaults → config.json → CLI overrides)
Pre-fill junction_entry from ctx['junction'] if set
Pre-fill target_entry from ctx['target'] if set
If it exists and is a junction, resolve and display its current target
If junction found, auto-populate target_entry with current junction target
If it does not exist, display 'No junction present'

steps: Read path from target_entry
If path exists, report 'Folder already exists'
If path does not exist, attempt to create it recursively
Update status_label with success or failure
Read junction path from junction_entry
Read target path from target_entry
Verify both paths are specified
Verify target path exists and is a directory
If junction_path exists and is a junction, remove it using rmdir
Create a new directory junction using mklink /J
Refresh displayed current target
Update status_label with success or failure
Read junction path from junction_entry
Verify junction path is specified
Verify junction exists and is a junction
Remove the junction using rmdir
Refresh displayed current target
Update status_label with success or failure
Open folder selection dialog
If user selects a folder, update junction_entry
Refresh current state display
Open folder selection dialog
If user selects a folder, update target_entry
Normalize path (convert forward slashes to backslashes)
If path exists, open it in Windows Explorer using os.startfile()
If path doesn't exist, open parent folder
Show error if neither exists

If path exists, open it in Windows Explorer using os.startfile()
If path doesn't exist, open parent folder
Show error if neither exists

junction_change_sync.description: When junction path changes and points to a valid junction, auto-populate target_entry with the junction's current target
junction_change_sync.trigger: Junction entry focus out or Enter key, when junction path differs from last known path

shell_integration.error_handling: Capture stdout, stderr, and return codes for display in status_label.

error_cases: junction_path exists but is not a junction
junction_path exists and is not removable
target path does not exist when pointing
target path is not a directory
mklink fails due to permissions or filesystem issues
non_goals: No automatic detection of active file writes

testing_notes.ui_testing: Tkinter widgets can be instantiated and tested without mainloop using direct method calls.
testing_notes.filesystem_testing: Shell calls should be mockable for unit tests; integration tests require NTFS.
testing_notes.cli_testing: lionscliapp provides reset() for test isolation.
testing_notes.expected_difficulty: Moderate for LLMs due to Windows junction semantics and shell invocation.

philosophy.design: Keep Chrome dumb; manipulate the filesystem instead.
philosophy.complexity: Intentionally minimal; flexible junction management with simple UI.
philosophy.cli_philosophy: Humane CLI with persistent config - set once, use forever, override when needed.
